job_description: Extreme Blue is IBM’s incubator for cutting-edge technology. Every summer, top students from across Canada come together in teams of 4 to collaborate and create solutions to real business problems. The projects are actual IBM endeavors and represent product enhancements and futuristic work. Throughout the 15 weeks, teams will pitch their solution to clients, IBM Executives and travel to the IBM HQ in New York to pitch to senior leadership. We are looking for your fresh perspective, creativity, and enthusiasm in designing these solutions!Check out our various social media pages for a peek in to our program.Facebook: IBM – Extreme Blue CanadaTumblr: ibmextremeblue.tumblr.comTwitter: @extremebluecanMain Responsibilities include:• Take full ownership of an emerging business opportunity for IBM• Lead a team of 3 talented technical interns that develops the solution• Engage IBM’s business and technical leaders from different teams, divisions, and countries to develop a solid business case and design a go-to-market strategy for your product• Perfect your presentation skills as you pitch your solution across North America• Learn about IBM’s products and divisions while creating a powerful network and landing your dream job!
job_requirements: Qualifications:• Interest and aptitude for business challenges in a high-paced, dynamic, and technology-driven environment• Degree specializing in business (BBA, HBA, MBA)• Desire and demonstrated capability to effectively work in a team-oriented setting, both as a team player and a leader• History of personal initiatives for exploring technology, illustrated by a clear understanding of Information Technology business trends• Passion, ambition, creativity, resourcefulness, and relentless dedicationAssets:• Knowledge of IBM products• Knowledge of the software development cycle• Understanding of software engineeringFINE PRINT:1. You must apply for this internship at www.ibm.com/extremeblue. Candidates who only apply through the school's job posting system will not be considered.2. 2015 program will be May 2015 to August 2015. Given the fast-paced nature of the internship, these dates are inflexible. Should you have exams scheduled during the initial portion of the internship, prior arrangements must be made with your university to either defer exams or write these at a designated examination centre in the city of the internship.3. Preference will be given to candidates who are within 12 months of their graduation.For the Summer 2015 session, we are bursting with ideas for ambitious projects involving “hot” technologies like Mobile Business Intelligence, Business Analytics and Optimization, High Performance Computing, and Social Media Analytics.For more information about Extreme Blue, and to apply, visit www.ibm.com/extremeblue.Application deadline is January 30, 2015.Open To All Majors:No
